page.title: 19St Giles RC Church Cheadle
page.content: (by Christopher Jones& Johanne Coxon) The Earl of Shrewsbury was a very rich man who lived at Alton Towers in the (19 He wanted to build a beautiful Catholic Church near his home.He asked a famous Architect called Augustus Pugin to design the Church.It was built of sand stone in 1846.It has a very tall spire(60 metres) which is a local landmark.There are 3 main altars.One has a painting of a vision of Heaven above it.The windows & the pillars& tiles are beautifully decorated.The doors are decorated with Talbot dogs,the Earl ofShrewsbury's badge.Last year the Church had to have a new roof.It cost 56,000 pounds.Most of the money was raised by Parish Collections.The Parish Priest is The Rev.Fr.Thomas Cockburn.
